gene.gene_description: A non-coding repeated sequence best characterised from an array located between @Hsp70Ba@ and @Hsp70Bb@ whose transcription is induced by heat shock. The transcripts are not translated.

allele.internal_note: Correspondence with P. Deak establishes that a lethal phase of "A" in Appendix A means that the stock can't be maintained without a balancer which he says means semi-lethal. gm020211. No non-complementing deficiency so entirely possible that the insertion is separable from the lethality. gm020211.

gene.internal_note: Correspondence with Bing Zhang confirms AP-2 is the same gene as &agr;-Adaptin.
gene.reference: FBrf0093110 == ew5036.hf == Gonzalez-Gaitan and Jackle, 1997, Cell 88(6): 767--776
gene.internal_note: I did not change the gene symbol to &agr;Ada as the group that first isolated the gene (S. Dornan and N. Gay, FBrf0084971) have used the symbol DAA in their paper that is under review. So symbol will become AA, (Aa is preoccupied).

phenotype.phenotype_desc: In presynaptic terminals @&agr;-Adaptin@ defines a network-like membrane structure to which the GTPase dynamin is recruited. @&agr;-Adaptin@ is necessary for the formation of clathrin coated pits and participates in the dynamin-dependent release of coated vesicles from the membrane surface. Results suggest an @&agr;-Adaptin@-dependent control of the vesicle cycle that maintains the balance between the amount of vesicle- and surface-associated membranes.

FBrf0098232 == gm2954.h == Dornan et al., 1997, Molec. Biol. Cell 8(8): 1391--1403
gene.misc_comment: An @&agr;-Adaptin@ cDNA has been cloned and sequenced, and its expression pattern has been analysed.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: Slow moving larvae die as pupae. FM1-43 assay demonstrates the mutation impairs the formation of endocytotic synaptic vesicles.

allele.molecular_info: @P{PZ}@ insertion into the first exon.
allele.misc_comment: Excision of the @P-element@ results in normal adults indicating the @P{PZ}@ insertion causes the lethal phenotype.

allele.internal_note: fb-JOBS 60. kk011026. fb-JOBS 70. kk011112. fb-JOBS 25. ds030108.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: Muscle contractions are sporadic and larvae fail to hatch from the egg shell. Architecture of the nervous system of the embryos is not affected by lack of @&agr;-Adaptin@. Ultrastructure of the presynaptic terminal shows absence of synaptic boutons and deep folds in the presynaptic membrane.

allele.molecular_info: 3kb deletion encompassing the nontranscribed upstream sequences, the
two first introns and the N-terminal region of the protein encoded
by both transcripts.
allele.reference: FBrf0111373 == rd3662.hf == Gonzalez-Gaitan and Jackle, 1999, Mech. Dev. 87(1-2): 143--151

phenotype.phenotype_desc: The @&agr;-Adaptin<up>3</up>@/@&agr;-Adaptin<up>4</up>@ combination causes a temperature-dependent wing phenotype. At 18<up>o</up>C the mutant wings are normal. At 25<up>o</up>C wings are reduced in size and show vein pattern defects, truncations, along the A/P axis. At 29<up>o</up>C only wing remnants are left. The remnants develop diagnostic dorsoventral pattern elements, indicating that only A/P axis is affected. Homozygous clones induced during early larval development do not survive. Clones induced late in larval development do survive but at a growth disadvantage compared to wild type twin spots.

At 25<up>o</up>C wings are reduced in size and show vein pattern defects, truncations, along the A/P axis. At 29<up>o</up>C only wing remnants are left. The remnants develop diagnostic dorsoventral pattern elements, indicating that only A/P axis is affected.

phenotype.phenotype_manifest_in: external sensory organ precursor cell IIb
external sensory organ precursor cell IIa
phenotype.phenotype_desc: In somatic clones of @&agr;-Adaptin<up>ear4</up>@ in the head, most bristles are transformed to have 2-4 socket cells and no shaft. In @&agr;-Adaptin<up>ear4</up>@ somatic clones in the head, 92% of the macrochaetae show cell fate transformations of either pIIb into pIIa or hair to socket. Similar defects, although at a lower frequency, occur in microchaetae in these clones.

allele.molecular_info: Amino acid replacement: R841@.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: @&agr;-Cat@ has been cloned and sequenced, and its expression pattern has been analysed.

gene.gene_description: &agr;-catenin is a component of a membrane-associated complex that includes the @arm@ and @aagp@ gene products.
gene.misc_comment: Isolated from a genomic library, using a mouse &agr;E-catenin cDNA as a probe, under low stringency conditions.
gene.internal_note: Genes93 has this gene but no refs. This paper cites Oda et al J Cell Biol in press. I am presuming that they are the same gene.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: The @&agr;-Cat@ gene product is part of a membrane-associated complex that includes the @arm@ and @aagp@ gene products.

gene.reference: FBrf0080740 == ew8031 == Kirkpatrick and Peifer, 1995, Curr. Opin. Genet. Dev. 5(1): 56--65

record_synonym.reference: FBrf0085679 == Oda et al., 1996, A. Dros. Res. Conf. 37: 199
FBrf0090729 == ew4859.h == Orsulic and Peifer, 1996, J. Cell Biol. 134(5): 1283--1300

phenotype.phenotype_desc: The binding sites for @shg@ and @&agr;-Cat@ are mapped on @arm@ protein, these bind independently of each other to @arm@ and binding of each is required for the function of adherens junctions.

Yeast two-hybrid system and in vivo assays have identified a 76 amino acid region of @arm@ that is necessary and sufficient for binding @&agr;-Cat@ and also that the N-terminal 258 amino acids of @&agr;-Cat@ interact with @arm@.

gene.reference: FBrf0091292 == ew4514.h == Tanaka-Matakatsu et al., 1996, Development 122(12): 3697--3705

FBrf0093177 == ew8852.h == Oda et al., 1997, Genes to Cells 2(1): 29--40

gene.misc_comment: Multiple regions of homology in the @Vinc@ and @&agr;-Cat@ sequences suggest the proteins may have overlapping functions.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: Embryos injected with @&agr;-Cat@ dsRNA (made by annealing @&agr;-Cat<up>cMa</up>@ and @&agr;-Cat<up>a.cMa</up>@ RNA) cannot carry out the cell movements that accompany the early stages of gastrulation and fail to form recognisable structures.

allele.molecular_info: Construct: Template corresponding to @&agr;-Cat@ sequences in the antisense orientation.
allele.misc_comment: Single-stranded RNA (ssRNA) has been synthesised from the template and annealed with ssRNA produced from @&agr;-Cat<up>cMa</up>@ to produce dsRNA. The dsRNA has been injected into embryos to study the phenotypic consequences of dsRNA interference (RNAi) of the @&agr;-Cat@ gene.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: Embryos injected with @&agr;-Cat@ dsRNA (made by annealing @&agr;-Cat<up>cMa</up>@ and @&agr;-Cat<up>a.cMa</up>@ RNA) cannot carry out the cell movements that accompany the early stages of gastrulation and fail to form recognisable structures.

allele.molecular_info: Construct: Template corresponding to @&agr;-Cat@ sequences in the sense orientation.
allele.misc_comment: Single-stranded RNA (ssRNA) has been synthesised from the template and annealed with ssRNA produced from @&agr;-Cat<up>a.cMa</up>@ to produce dsRNA. The dsRNA has been injected into embryos to study the phenotypic consequences of dsRNA interference (RNAi) of the @&agr;-Cat@ gene.

allele.molecular_info: Construct: Template corresponds to @&agr;-Cat@ sequences.
allele.misc_comment: dsRNA has been synthesised from the template and added to the culture medium of S2R+ cells to study its effect on @arm@ protein accumulation.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: Expression of @&agr;-Cat<up>Scer\UAS.P\T.cMa</up>@ under the control of @Scer\GAL4<up>Act5C.PI</up>@ results in about 15% lethality, with 1/3 of these embryos showing very mild segmentation defects.

allele.allele_interaction: Genetic interaction (effect, anatomy): enhancer, embryonic segment { Rho1<up>unspecified</up>, Scer\GAL4<up>Act5C.PI</up> } The incidence and severity of segmentation defects in homozygous @Rho1@ mutant embryos is enhanced by expression of @&agr;-Cat<up>Scer\UAS.P\T.cMa</up>@ under the control of @Scer\GAL4<up>Act5C.PI</up>@.
allele.molecular_info: Construct: @Scer\UAS@ regulatory sequences and @P\T@ promoter sequences drive
expression of the @&agr;-Cat@ open reading frame.

allele.greference: FBrf0144779 == cy1553.hf == Le Borgne et al., 2002, Curr. Biol. 12(2): 95--104
FBrf0107917 == gm5958.h == Oda and Tsukita, 1999, Dev. Genes Evol. 209(4): 218--225

allele.reference: FBrf0107917 == gm5958.h == Oda and Tsukita, 1999, Dev. Genes Evol. 209(4): 218--225

origin.origin_entry: in vitro construct | coding region fusion

phenotype.phenotype_desc: No morphological abnormalities are seen in embryos expressing @&agr;-Cat<up>Scer\UAS.T:Avic\GFP-sg</up>@ under the control of @Scer\GAL4<up>en-e16E</up>@.

allele.molecular_info: Construct: @Scer\UAS@ regulatory sequences drive expression of full length @&agr;-Cat@
tagged at the carboxyl terminus with @T:Avic\GFP@.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: @&agr;-Cat<up>Scer\UAS.T:Avic\GFP-sg</up>@ when driven by @Scer\GAL4<up>btl.PS</up>@ produces embryos with normal adherens junction patterns. Almost all (98.9%) dorsal trunk fusions are successful.

phenotype.phenotype_desc: Stage 16 embryos expressing @&agr;-Cat::shg<up>Scer\UAS.cNa</up>@ under the control of @Scer\GAL4<up>da.G32</up>@ show a lack of separation of the optic lobe and Bolwig's organ.

allele.molecular_info: Construct: @Scer\UAS@ regulatory sequences drive expression of a fusion protein
in which the cytoplasmic tail of @shg@ has been replaced by a truncated
form of @&agr;-Cat@ lacking the N-terminal domain.

cyto_location.cloc: Limits computationally determined from genome sequence between @P{EP}EP3060<up>EP3060</up>@ and @P{PZ}grn<up>05930</up>@

phenotype.phenotype_desc: Eleven putative esterase genes from the region containing the &agr;-esterase cluster are cloned. The complete amino acid sequence of @&agr;-Est1@ contains motifs characteristic of a functional carboxyl/cholinesterase.

gene.molecular_info: Gene order: Overall orientation not stated: &agr;-Est1+ &agr;-Est2-
